Highly recommend. One of the best games I've played.

I'm not entirely sure I like it more than Portal 1, but it's definitely far more polished than Portal 1. But with that, comes some restrictions in the way it plays in some ways. Walls that can have a Portal are not placed all over the room in the same way Portal 1 does it, making the solution often stand out more. This can be seen as a good and bad thing. Alternative solutions to some puzzles doesn't really exist in this game. But given the much larger scale of the puzzles, it makes sense. And it's far from being braindead easy. The game still manages to make you feel smart, even when it's sort of telling you how to solve it.

I also both like and dislike the many hidden ways the game guides you into the solutions. Mechanics like portal funneling are on by default and can't be toggled in the menu the same way as Portal 1, but most people likely won't notice and it just makes the game much easier to play. I'm not the biggest fan of the larger amount of invisible walls, but I understand their existence and it doesn't really detract from the game that much anyway.

Story is pretty good. I have some personal issues with it, but that may just be me. It's overall well written, funny, dark, and intriguing all at once.

Also co-op is fun. Seeing the TF2 style hats and taunts, and also seeing that it was near immediately abandoned is funny to me.

Play this game if you haven't. It goes on sale for like two bucks and is apart of the valve pack that everyone should own anyway.

Easily in my top 5 games of all time! played it on the Xbox 360 back when it came out and is still better than most AAA games today.  The characters, world, atmosphere, humor, and story are all perfectly executed. This game is so much better as an adult but i can say it is for all ages and it gets better every time i play it and discover new things. Probably no one will read this review but just wanted to say this game makes me laugh cry and feel good every time i play it i hope it does the same for you!

i have played through both portal games and have played portal 2 and portal 1's story mode's many times each and  i have been loving these games for a long time i dont have a lot of hours on steam because i originally played it on xbox but im in love with these games to anyone who hasn't experienced these games, its a must. i never write reviews but this game series and this game alone have made me want to take the time out of my day to write this. and one final thing even if recently they have fallen from grace, i still want to say, thank you valve

Just awesome! Worth my money! Whether it was the single player version or the coop one, I just loved it! 
The single player version was more challenging than the coop version, but still I've got nothing but positive things to say about this game. If you're looking for a coop game to play with your friend AND making your brains work at their full power, then trying out this game is exactly what I'd expect out of a coop game which would include strategy and logic.
This is a great addition to the Portal story line.  It has more puzzles and backstory.  It also includes a co-op puzzles which add to the game.
